entries.notes: Op. 9 no. 4 of 1770 ('opera grande') in Boccherini's autograph catalogue.

sources.autograph: Lucca, Istituto Musicale Boccherini, D.I.33, 'Sonata a quattro no. 8...' (for comment, see No. 171)
sources.ms_copies_score: Lucca, Istituto Musicale Boccherini, B.I.114, 'Sonata a quattro no. 8...'
ms_copies_parts: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.611a, 'Quartetto no. 1...' (for comment, see No. 171)
Münster, Priesterseminarbibliothek, Santini HS.529, 'Opera III°, Concerto primo...' (for comment, see No. 171)
Naples, Conservatorio. Two copies: 22.2.10, and 22.3.2, 'Quartetto no. 1...'
sources.first_edition: December, 1772, Paris, Vénier: Op. 10 no. 3 (for title, see No. 171)
later_editions: (c. 1780), London, Brenner: Op. 10 no. 3 (for title, see No. 171)
(c. 1785), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 7 no. 3 (for title, see No. 171)
(c. 1785), London, Preston: Op. 10 no. 3 (for title, see No. 171)
(c. 1790), Paris, Boyer: Op. 10 no. 3 (for title, see No. 171)

partial_notes: The page continues with detailed source information for the previous entry, discussing that the quartet begins with a Largo that was likely a brief introduction suppressed when the work was engraved. Reference is made to MS. at Lucca (D.I.33) and Picquot's hypothesis about Boccherini's performance practice.
